column4: can I use the command "sudo rm /media/disk/.Trash-root" to delete the folder? or do I need to go further into the directory to remove?
use the -R option with that as well if the folder isn't empty.
what do you mean? there's folders (but they're read only) in the .Trash-root folder. That's what i need to get rid of. How do I type in the command? "sudo rm -r /media/disk/.Trash-root"?
